material.mattext: Three people are chosen at random. What is the probability that they all have the same blood type?

To get all three the same, either the first and the second and the third are type O, or the first and the second and the third are type A, or the first and the second and the third are type B, or the first and the second and the third are type AB. The probability is .44*.44*.44 + .42*.42*.42 + .10*.10*.10 + .04*.04*.04=.160336. About 15% or 16% of the time, three randomly chosen people would have the same blood type.
